page.title: 09Notcutts Garden Centre
page.content: Mr. Birt the manager of{Notcutts}took over the Nursery in 1968. Previously it was called Abbots after its owner. It used to cover a lot of Ardleigh but now the garden centre has only 11.1/2 acres. They serve about 60,000 people every year. They have got a large carpark, a tea and coffee machine, a children's play ground and toilets. Mr.Birt has been the manager for 16yrs.The Nursery was built in the late 1700s and has been open 200 yrs. It employs 4 full time,and 3 part time workers. They have over 2,500 varieties of trees and bushes, which they water with spray lines. Mr. Birt said the business is doing very well. The barn was moved there from Gt. Bentley Green after the first world war.
